title: Multiple "disconnect"/ "ping spikes"
body:
For the past few days I have been unable to play a single game witgout disconnecting every 9-16 seconds. Now it never actually SAYS disconnecting, it just goes to an absurd amount of ping and everything freezes in the game for a few seconds; then of course it catches up by super speeding everyone around the map. I also cannot issue new commands during this "disconnect"/"ping spike" state. 

I could reallllly use some help on this if you guys could spare some time to look into it. I'll try to find your tracert instructions so I can link them for you.

Thanks again

Edit: after trying a lot of the things on your troubleshoot connections guide, it looks like flushing the DNS worked. I'll keep an eye on it to see if anything else comes up, but for people having the same issue give it a try.

Edit2: Nope, still a problem after DNS flush. Done everything I could do on the troubleshoot connection list. None of it worked. I'm at a loss as to what I can do.

These are the reults from Netalyzr(which no longer works with chrome btw):
Major Abnormalities
–

    Your DNS resolver returns IP addresses for names that do not exist
    Your DNS resolver manipulates results for IPv6 addresses 

Minor Aberrations
–

    Certain UDP protocols are blocked in outbound traffic
    The network latency was somewhat high
    The time to set up a TCP connection was somewhat high
    The DNS resolver may have problems with DNSSEC
    Your DNS server accepts unusual glue records

replies.body:
Hey Novellae, 

With the amount of ping issues you're having and with your computer freezing you may want to try Riots Connection KB. I was having similar issues and I followed the steps and it fixed me up. 

Connection KB: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-troubleshooting

That should fix you right up! Reach out to me if that doesn't :)
